trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of renal specific vitamins and minerals supplementation (KVITAL) on the nutritional status and psychological wellbeing of the Haemodialysis patient: pilot study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of renal specific vitamins and minerals supplementation (KVITAL) on the nutritional status and psychological wellbeing of the Haemodialysis patient: pilot study

interventions.interventions: Assess whether routine vitamins supplementation, using a brand of vitamins formulation that is appropriate for Chronic Kidney Disease (Kidney Vital) improves patients nutritional status and quality of life. One tablet to be taken daily, orally for 6 months Active Ingredients and doses outlined below. Ascorbic acid 60 mg Biotin 30 microgram Calcium pantothenate 5 mg Cholecalciferol .025 mg Copper gluconate 900 microgram Cyanocobalamin 2.4 microgram Ferrous fumarate 8 mg Folic acid 400 microgram Nicotinic acid 20 mg Pyridoxine hydrochloride 10 mg Riboflavin 2 mg Sodium selenate 55 microgram Thiamine nitrate 1.5 mg Zinc oxide Vitamin levels will be monitored with pathology testing, pre study and post commencement of study. Patients will be given a SF-36 Quality of life questionnaire and Subjective Global Assessment pre and post commencment of study to enstablish patient nutritional and psychological wellbeing. Patients will be educated on the benefits of taking a daily vitamin supplement to their nutritional status and well being.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Vitamin and mineral defiency in haemodialysis patients may be improved with vitamin supplementation. This outcome will be assessed by comparing pre study and post study blood pathology of vitamin and mineral levels
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At 6 months post commencement of vitamin supplement

primaryOutcome.outcome: Patients nutritional status and quality of life may be improved with implementation of a renal specific vitamin supplement to the haemodialysis patient. This outcome will be assessed using SGA and SF-36 Quality of life questionnaire, comparing pre and post results of vitamin supplement
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 6 months post commencement of vitamin supplement

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Chronic Kidney Disease stage 5 currently on haemodialysis at selected satellite unit
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Unable to comply to taking vitamin tablet daily for six month period of study

trial_design.concealment: Patients will be educated on the benefits of taking a daily vitamin supplement. They will be advised they will be required to purchase the supplement and commit to taking the vitamin for the 6 months of the trial poject.

fundingsource.fundingname: Frankston Hospital Department of Medicine - Renal

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Assess whether routine vitamins supplementation, that is appropriate for Chronic Kidney Disease (Kidney Vital) improves patients nutritional status and quality of life.
